title.narrative: Provision of Life-saving and Life-sustaining support to drought and conflict affected people through Multi-sectoral approach of Integrated Protection WASH interventions for IDPs and host communities in Kahda, Daynile and Dharkenley districts in Mogadishu and Afgooye corridor of Lower Shabelle region

description.narrative:
The main aim of this project is to provide integrated life-saving emergency Protection and WASH services package to IDPs and host community in Kahda, Daynile and Dharkenley Districts of Benadir and in Afgooye corridor. Protection: SOYDA will address GBV prevention amp response through three interrelated sets of activities: prevention, response (survivor assistance) and coordination: - Prevention component: The activities include training the Community on Safety amp Awareness Mobilizers in approaches and methods to proper survivor-centered care, raising awareness in communities about available confidential services, referral networks, dignity kit, amp solar touch distributions. The prevention also includes prevention of child recruitment through constructing child friendly space. - Response activities of the project include provision of quality medical services to women and girls who are survivors of GBV through SOYDA health centers in our target areas. SOYDA will also apply the following principles "privacy, confidentiality, safety of survivors and family while providing medical assistance to GBV survivors. SOYDA will also identify children at risk and referral to child protection expert organizations. The action includes recreational activities will be supported to the children at risk through establishment of child friendly space to protect children from violence, recruitment and any other evil doing, provide a safe, protective space, and to support delivery of psychosoical support.
For WASH, The project will ensure and provide emergency and sustainable WASH services (latrines with hand washing facilities and safe drinking water through water trucking. For sustainable safe water services, SOYDA will upgrade one borehole equipped with hybrid to improve its water quality and reduce its running cost, in order to receive water in affordable cost. SOYDA will replace hybrid borehole and construct 5 water kiosks nearer to the IDP settlements supplied water through piping network to avoid the risk of rape against women and girls. The project will also promote adaption of good hygiene and sanitation practices through carrying out comprehensive hygiene promotion awareness amp hygiene kit distribution and construction of 60 gender-sensitive and flood proof IDP latrines with lockable doors and hand washing facilities, rehabilitation of 30 IDP latrines and establishment of faecal sludge management (FSM) sites and systems to the Daynile and Kahda districts the team is composed 6 persons shared equally by men and women. Systems will be composed of trained FSM teams equipped with personal protection equipment, safe excreta transportation system (trash pump and donkey cart with tank) and a final disposal site designed so as to avoid contamination of water points. The FSM team also will serve as mobile sanitation team in case of AWD/Cholera outbreak in the camps and will be trained on AWD/Cholera preparedness.
SOYDA will provide integrated protection centered emergency and life sustaining response, covering interventions in WASH and Protection, while SSWC will cover CCCM and shelter/NFI in the beneficiaries and locations as an integrated in accordance to SRC recommendation, both SOYDA and SSWC agreed to work together an cover 14 IDP camps in Daynile, Kahda, Dharkenley and Afgooye corridor. The interventions will build on SOYDA's ongoing activities in target areas and will reach the most vulnerable people without duplicating the efforts
Finally, coordinate with CCCM, Shelter/NFI, WASH, and protection clusters to coordinate response activities for maximum impact to beneficiaries. SOYDA shall also coordinates with other local actors in the target district to enable avoid any duplication of services as well work in a coordinated manner to enable increase access to life-saving emergency response in the areas.
